TASK_APPEND.instillShortDescription: Append values to create or extend an array, or add key-value pairs to an object.

data.description: The input data. If it's an array, the value will be appended. If it's an object, the key-value pairs from value will be added. If it's a primitive type (string, number, boolean), it will be converted to a single-element array before appending.
data.title: Data

value.description: The value to append. For arrays: the value will be appended as a new element. For objects: if value is an object, its key-value pairs will be added to the input object. For primitives: value will be appended to create/extend an array.
value.title: Value

output.description: Output containing the modified data structure.

data.description: The resulting data structure after the append operation. Will be either an array (if input was array or primitive) or an object (if input was object). Examples: [1,2,3], {'name':'John', 'age':25}, or ['hello','world'].
data.title: Data

output.title: Output

TASK_ASSIGN.instillShortDescription: Assign a value to a specific path in a data structure.

data.description: The input data structure to modify. Can be an array, object, or primitive value.
data.title: Data

path.description: The path where to assign the value. Use dot notation for nested objects and [n] for array indices. Examples: 'users.[0].name', '.[0].key', 'metadata.tags.[2]'.
path.title: Path

value.description: The value to assign at the specified path. Can be any type (string, number, boolean, array, or object).
value.title: Value

output.description: Output containing the modified data structure.

data.description: The resulting data structure after the assign operation.
data.title: Data

output.title: Output

TASK_CONCAT.instillShortDescription: Concatenate multiple arrays or merge multiple objects into a single collection.

input.description: Input parameters for concat operation. Can handle both arrays and objects.

data.description: An array of arrays or objects to be concatenated/merged. For arrays: [[1, 2], [3, 4]] becomes [1, 2, 3, 4]. For objects: [{'a': 1}, {'b': 2}] becomes {'a': 1, 'b': 2}. Later values override earlier ones for objects.
data.title: Data

input.title: Input

data.description: The resulting array or object after concat operation.
data.title: Data

TASK_DIFFERENCE.instillShortDescription: Find elements that exist in the first array or object but not in any of the other arrays or objects.

input.description: Input parameters for difference operation. Can handle both arrays and objects.

data.description: An array of arrays or objects to find the difference. The first element is compared against all subsequent elements. For example, given arrays [[1, 2, 3], [2, 3, 4], [3, 4, 5]], the result will be [1]. For objects, given [{'a': 1, 'b': 2}, {'b': 2, 'c': 3}], the result will be {'a': 1}.
data.title: Data

input.title: Input

data.description: The resulting array or object after the difference operation.
data.title: Data

TASK_INTERSECTION.instillShortDescription: Find common elements that exist in all input arrays or objects.

input.description: Input parameters for intersection operation. Can handle both arrays and objects.

data.description: An array of arrays or objects to find common elements. For arrays: given [[1, 2, 3], [2, 3, 4]], the result will be [2, 3]. For objects: given [{'a': 1, 'b': 2}, {'b': 2, 'c': 3}], the result will be {'b': 2}.
data.title: Data

input.title: Input

data.description: The resulting array or object after the intersection operation.
data.title: Data

TASK_SPLIT.instillShortDescription: Split arrays or objects into smaller chunks.

data.description: The source data to be split. Can be: 1) An array to split into groups 2) An object to split by property count (keys are sorted alphabetically for consistent ordering)
data.title: Data

output.description: Output containing the split results. For objects, the properties in each chunk maintain alphabetical ordering of keys.

data.description: The resulting array after splitting. For arrays: array of subarrays. For objects: array of smaller objects with alphabetically ordered keys
data.title: Data

output.title: Output

TASK_SYMMETRIC_DIFFERENCE.instillShortDescription: Find elements that exist in exactly one of the input arrays or objects, but not in multiple inputs.

input.description: Input parameters for symmetric difference operation. Can handle both arrays and objects.

data.description: An array of arrays or objects to find symmetric difference. For arrays: given [[1, 2], [2, 3]], the result will be [1, 3]. For objects: given [{'a': 1, 'b': 2}, {'b': 2, 'c': 3}], the result will be {'a': 1, 'c': 3}.
data.title: Data

input.title: Input

output.description: Output containing the symmetric difference result.

data.description: The resulting array or object after the symmetric difference operation.
data.title: Data

output.title: Output

TASK_UNION.instillShortDescription: Find unique elements that exist in any of the input arrays or objects.

input.description: Input parameters for union operation. Can handle both arrays and objects.

data.description: An array of arrays or objects to find unique elements. For arrays: given [[1, 2], [2, 3]], the result will be [1, 2, 3]. For objects: given [{'a': 1, 'b': 2}, {'b': 2, 'c': 3}], the result will be {'a': 1, 'b': 2, 'c': 3}.
data.title: Data

input.title: Input

data.description: The resulting array or object after the union operation.
data.title: Data
